needs.description: WHO reports that only 45% of health facilities are fully functional, with 20% completely non-operational due to fuel shortages and damaged infrastructure. Cholera cases have surged to 45,000 suspected cases in the first quarter of 2026, with children under 5 accounting for 30% of infections.

UNICEF data shows 17.8 million people lack access to safe water and sanitation, with 4.5 million in acute need in Sana'a governorate. Sewage system failures have led to contamination of water sources, exacerbating disease spread.

IPC analysis indicates 2.3 million people in Sana'a governorate are in IPC Phase 3 (Crisis) or higher, with 400,000 in Phase 4 (Emergency). Food prices have increased by 35% since January 2026 due to disrupted supply chains.
